title: Here's how much plastic enters the ocean each year - Science
body: The scientists figured roughly 15% to 40% of that littered or dumped plastic enters the ocean each year. Adding together all 192 countries in the world with a significant coastal population, the researchers report online today in Science that about 4 million to 12 million metric tons of plastic washed offshore in 2010 alone, or about 1.5% to 4. ...
readable_content: - TheJuanAndOnly (2023-12-08): This is an interesting article about the amount of plastic that enters the ocean annually. According to the text, researchers estimated that about 4 million to 12 million metric tons of plastic washed offshore in 2010 alone. They also predict that the annual amount of plastic waste entering the ocean will more than double in the next 10 years. This insight sheds light on a critical environmental issue.
summary: The information shared about the amount of plastic entering the ocean annually is concerning and highlights the urgency of addressing this environmental issue. It is important for individuals and governments to take action to reduce plastic waste and its impact on the oceans. Sentiment: 0.9
